newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola closes up amid good crusher demand.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola closes up amid good crusher demand.

text.p: WCE canola futures settled higher on Wednesday bolstered by good crusher buying at the close, traders said.
August was exiting the board on Wednesday which accounted for its declines, one trader said.
He noted that flaxseed did not trade. It was bid up by locals and commercials and there was no selling, he said.
August canola was off $0.50 to $459.50 a tonne while September canola gained $1.20 at $424.70.

Another trader said the feature in the feed wheat was the October/December spread. "Firmness in the nearby cash position supported October feed wheat," he said. The October/December spread closed at $12.50 a tonne over the December, up from Tuesday's close of $11.10, he said.
Western barley had continued liquidation in the August position which expired on Wednesday.
The trader said commercial buying buoyed November barley with commercials as both buyers and sellers in the August position.
August western barley lost $3.40 at $159.00 while nearby November rose $1.60 to $158.90. October feed wheat climbed $3.40 at $202.00 and December gained $2.00 to $189.50.
Very little activity was noted in feed peas, he said.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats, which are in U.S. dollars.)
